docs.snippet: Being injured when a new coach comes to town is not a formula for security or success.      ''I was worried about my place on the team,'' MetroStars midfielder MARK LISI said. ''It definitely was a tough situation. We had a new coach and I wanted to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Being injured when a new coach comes to town is not a formula for security or success. ''I was worried about my place on the team,'' MetroStars midfielder MARK LISI said. ''It definitely was a tough situation. We had a new coach and I wanted to prove myself, but I couldn't do it sitting on the sideline.''

headline.main: MetroStars Midfielder Comes Back; U.S. Defeats Martinique in Gold Cup

docs.snippet: In his Major League Soccer debut for the MetroStars, goalkeeper JONNY WALKER did not have a shutout -- a clean sheet, in soccer jargon. He also did not have a chance to stop Dallas's lone goal, he did not yield a rebound and he did not make a mistake...
docs.lead_paragraph: In his Major League Soccer debut for the MetroStars, goalkeeper JONNY WALKER did not have a shutout -- a clean sheet, in soccer jargon. He also did not have a chance to stop Dallas's lone goal, he did not yield a rebound and he did not make a mistake (the same cannot be said for Burn keeper D.J. COUNTESS) in a 2-1 overtime victory. MetroStars Coach BOB BRADLEY could not have asked for more from Walker, who was obtained last week by the MetroStars to replace TIM HOWARD, who signed with Manchester United. Walker, 28, has a tough act to follow. A native of California who played at the University of Louisville, Walker had played professionally in Chile since July 1997 and is the only American to have played in the Libertadores Cup, the South American club championship, according to the MetroStars.

headline.main: MetroStars' New Goalie Shines in His First Game

docs.snippet: ''Don Luis! Don Luis!'' cried a small blond boy, abandoning his playmates around a fountain and leaping into the outstretched arms of Dr. Luis Bricio, the mayor of this village on the brown, sunburned plains of Aragon. ''This is Vlad,'' the mayor...
docs.lead_paragraph: ''Don Luis! Don Luis!'' cried a small blond boy, abandoning his playmates around a fountain and leaping into the outstretched arms of Dr. Luis Bricio, the mayor of this village on the brown, sunburned plains of Aragon. ''This is Vlad,'' the mayor said. ''He learned Spanish in 20 days.'' Vlad David, 8, may be the future of Aguaviva. Decades of migration to the cities have left rural communities struggling to survive, but here the school rolls are up and the Spanish is accented, thanks to the mayor's recruitment of new residents from Latin America and Eastern Europe.
docs.abstract: Dozens of Spanish villages are inviting immigrants to move in and take jobs that no longer attract enough locals; to centralize supply and demand, they have formed Spanish Assn of Towns Against Depopulation; group has 130 member communities; they seek married couples under 40, without college degrees, with work permits and at least two children under 12, to sign five-year contracts; in return, they offer jobs, housing at low monthly rent, free medical care and schooling; photo of Mayor Luis Bricio of Aguaviva and Romanian and Argentinian immigrants who have moved to his village; map (M)

headline.main: Aguaviva Journal; By Enticing Foreigners, Villages Grow Young Again

docs.snippet: The Dutch food retailer Royal Ahold said yesterday that an Argentine court had seized the shares of its supermarket chain Disco, potentially blocking a planned sale of the unit. The seizure was made at the request of creditors and depositors at Banco...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Dutch food retailer Royal Ahold said yesterday that an Argentine court had seized the shares of its supermarket chain Disco, potentially blocking a planned sale of the unit. The seizure was made at the request of creditors and depositors at Banco Montevideo, a bank in Uruguay that was once tied to an Ahold partner in South America, the Velox Group. Ahold, which owns Stop & Shop, Giant and Tops in the United States, said that it was confident it could get a judge to reverse the ruling within days. Gregory Crouch (NYT)
docs.abstract: Dutch food retailer Royal Ahold reports Argentine court has seized shares of its Disco supermarket chain, potentially blocking planned sale of unit; seizure came at request of creditors and depositors at Banco Montevideo, bank in Uruguay that was once tied to an Ahold partner, Velox Group (S)

headline.main: World Business Briefing | Europe: The Netherlands: Store's Shares Seized

docs.snippet: Hispanics view the Democratic Party as better able than the Republican Party to manage the economy, create jobs and improve the nation's public school system, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll. But they admire President Bush and have...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hispanics view the Democratic Party as better able than the Republican Party to manage the economy, create jobs and improve the nation's public school system, according to a New York Times/CBS News poll. But they admire President Bush and have embraced positions -- from supporting tax cuts to opposing abortion and some gay rights -- that have typically been identified with Republicans. The poll, an unusually extensive effort to measure the political and social attitudes of those who call themselves Hispanic, revealed a complex challenge facing both parties as they battle to command the support of a segment of the electorate that is on the verge of rivaling African-Americans in numbers.
docs.abstract: New York Times/CBS News poll finds that Hispanics view Democratic Party as better able than Republican Party to manage economy, create jobs and improve nation's public school system, but that they also admire Pres Bush and have embraced positions that have typically been identified with Republicans, such as supporting tax cuts and opposing abortion and some gay rights; suggests that both parties face complex challenge in winning support from Hispanics, segment of electorate that is on verge of rivaling African-Americans in numbers; reveals that Hispanics as less than monolithic in their background, culture and political beliefs; graphs (L)

headline.main: Hispanics Back Big Government And Bush, Too

byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY and JANET ELDER

docs.snippet: The United States men's basketball team leaves no margin for error.     The Americans advanced to the medal round at the Pan American Games with a 74-72 victory over Uruguay today. Rickey Paulding of Missouri hit two free throws in the final 33.6...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States men's basketball team leaves no margin for error. The Americans advanced to the medal round at the Pan American Games with a 74-72 victory over Uruguay today. Rickey Paulding of Missouri hit two free throws in the final 33.6 seconds and Seton Hall's Andre Barrett tied up a Uruguayan player with 9.1 seconds left, forcing a key turnover.
docs.abstract: US men's basketball team defeats Uruguay, 74-72, to advance to medal round at Pan American Games; US women defeat Brazil, 77-64; photo (M)

headline.main: U.S. Men and Women Post Basketball Victories

docs.snippet: The United States and Cuba showed their power today at the Pan American Games, winning gold medals and making headway in the preliminaries of various team sports.     In women's javelin, Kim Kreiner, who was not in a medal position before her last...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States and Cuba showed their power today at the Pan American Games, winning gold medals and making headway in the preliminaries of various team sports. In women's javelin, Kim Kreiner, who was not in a medal position before her last effort, threw 199 feet 8 inches. That exceeded her previous mark, an American record, by 7 inches and gave her the gold medal. She is the first American woman to win gold in Pan Ams javelin since 1975.
docs.abstract: US collects gold medals at Pan American Games preliminaries in women's javelin, dressage, men's saber and others (M)

docs.snippet: The rematch was a bust, too.    Cuba's women's basketball team beat the United States for the fifth straight time today, defeating the poor-shooting Americans, 75-64, for the gold medal at the Pan American Games.
docs.lead_paragraph: The rematch was a bust, too. Cuba's women's basketball team beat the United States for the fifth straight time today, defeating the poor-shooting Americans, 75-64, for the gold medal at the Pan American Games.
docs.abstract: Cuba national women's basketball team defeats US, 75-64, to win gold medal at Pan American Games; photo (M)

headline.main: Cuba's Women Defeat United States for Basketball Gold

docs.snippet: TIM HOWARD is a mild-mannered guy off the field but a fierce competitor when he is prowling his goal.      The 24-year-old Howard's whirlwind summer was thrust into another level on Sunday when he stopped two penalty kicks in Manchester United's...
docs.lead_paragraph: TIM HOWARD is a mild-mannered guy off the field but a fierce competitor when he is prowling his goal. The 24-year-old Howard's whirlwind summer was thrust into another level on Sunday when he stopped two penalty kicks in Manchester United's victory over Arsenal, United's archrival, in the Community Shield match in Cardiff, Wales.
docs.abstract: Manchester United goalie Tim Howard stops two penalty kicks in game against Arsenal (M)

headline.main: Howard Keeps Cool In a Roiling Caldron

docs.snippet: The United States beat Uruguay, 25-23, to win the bronze medal yesterday at the Pan American Games in Santo Domingo, Domincan Republic.     Goalie Danny Hennessey swatted away five penalty shots. ''Never would I imagine that I'd go 5 for 5 in any...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States beat Uruguay, 25-23, to win the bronze medal yesterday at the Pan American Games in Santo Domingo, Domincan Republic. Goalie Danny Hennessey swatted away five penalty shots. ''Never would I imagine that I'd go 5 for 5 in any game, let alone the bronze medal game,'' Hennessey, a New York City police officer, said.
docs.abstract: US defeats Uruguay, 25-23, to win bronze medal in handball at Pan American Games (S)

headline.main: U.S. Wins Bronze In Team Handball
